results.title: Partitalia Takes High-Tech Waste Collection to CES 2024
results.content: According to source familiar with the matter ( source ), Partitalia's participation in CES® 2024 signifies its dedication to driving innovation in the Italian and international waste collection sector while expanding its footprint in global markets. For more information or inquiries, please contact Partitalia's Marketing Office at this link.
results.raw_content:
Partitalia Takes High-Tech Waste Collection to CES 2024
The “Ecosense SmartBin Pro” is the latest innovative IoT trash can developed by Partitalia, an Italian technology company specializing in waste collection solutions. This cutting-edge product will be showcased at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES®) in Las Vegas, Nevada from January 9 to 12, 2024.
Partitalia has a strong focus on utilizing advanced technologies to optimize waste collection, improve delivery traceability, and reduce environmental impact. The company’s participation in CES® is strategic as it aims to consolidate its presence in the American market and introduce its groundbreaking product, “Ecosense SmartBin Pro”, to a global audience.
The “Ecosense SmartBin Pro” represents a significant leap forward in waste management technology. It features an electronic lock that can be opened via a web application, revolutionizing the way citizens interact with waste collection. This innovative approach empowers users by providing them with real-time information about their waste disposal habits and encouraging responsible behavior.
One of the key technological advancements of “Ecosense SmartBin Pro” is its integration of IoT technology, which enables efficient management of waste collection. The smart garbage container utilizes advanced sensor technology to measure the filling level and estimate the amount of waste generated by citizens. All this information is accessible through a dedicated web application, allowing users to monitor certified data on waste delivery and collection status.
Moreover, “Ecosense SmartBin Pro” incorporates an electronic lock that ensures only authorized users who are up-to-date with their payments can access the trash can. This feature not only promotes accountability but also facilitates Pay As You Go (PAYT) pricing based on actual waste consumption.
In tandem with to “Ecosense SmartBin Pro,” Partitalia is also introducing other innovations such as “Discovery Mobile,” a portable device for tracking waste collection data. These advancements underscore the company’s commitment to developing technologies that automate tracking and reduce environmental impact.
To learn more about Partitalia’s innovative solutions for waste management, visit their website at smartwaste.partitalia.com.
According to source familiar with the matter (source), Partitalia’s participation in CES® 2024 signifies its dedication to driving innovation in the Italian and international waste collection sector while expanding its footprint in global markets.
For more information or inquiries, please contact Partitalia’s Marketing Office at this link. You can also connect with them on social networks via Facebook
and LinkedIn.
With these groundbreaking developments, Partitalia continues to demonstrate its leadership in leveraging high-tech solutions for sustainable and efficient waste management practices.

Partitalia

About Partitalia
Partitalia manufactures and supplies different types of cards and smart cards. The company offers products such as smart cards, tags, radio frequency identification (RFID) readers, waste management solutions, and more. It was founded in 2001 and is based in Lainate, Italy.

Latest Partitalia News
Dec 19, 2023
News Provided By
Share This Article
"Ecosense SmartBin Pro" is the innovative IoT trash can that opens via a web app
MILAN, ITALY, December 19, 2023 / EINPresswire.com / -- From January 9 to 12, 2024, Partitalia will fly to Las Vegas, Nevada, to take part in the "Consumer Electronic Show (CES®)." Partitalia is an Italian tech company with expertise in Waste Collection that develops innovative solutions using advanced technologies, optimizing collection, quality and traceability of deliveries, to significantly reduce environmental impact. At ‘CES’ 2024, in the ITA (Italian Trade Agency) hall - booth 62202, the ICT company will present the latest innovations for the world of waste management. A STRATEGIC CHOICE
Partitalia aims to continue innovating the Italian and international waste collection sector in 2024. To this end the event in Las Vegas is strategic to consolidate its presence on the American market, to which it will present: "Ecosense SmartBin Pro", the first interconnected IoT trash can with electronic lock that opens simply via a web app and revolutionizes citizens’ interaction with waste collection. HIGH-TECH NEWS FOR WASTE COLLECTION: "ECOSENSE SMARTBIN PRO"
"Ecosense SmartBin Pro" is the brainchild of the R&D department of Partitalia's "Digital Waste Division". To develop the project, the team delved into the issue of empowering the user, a key player in the waste management chain, from collection to disposal. The process focuses on tracing waste, enabling higher quality waste collection. The innovation of "Ecosense SmartBin Pro" lies in the combination of IoT technology - which optimizes waste collection management - and features available to the user. Indeed, thanks to its advanced sensor technology, Partitalia's smart trash can measures the fill level, providing an estimate of the amount of waste generated by the citizens. All the related information is available on a dedicated web app, where - thanks to the two-way communication protocol - users monitor certified data on the waste delivered and the collection status. This is possible because "Ecosense SmartBin Pro" has an electronic lock that allows the trash can to be opened only by authorized users who are up to date with payments. The system - easily integrated with any management system - not only fully tracks waste, but also allows for PAYT (Pay-As-You-Throw) pricing, calculated on the basis of actual waste consumption. Among the many innovations, in addition to "Discovery Mobile", the first wearable device to track waste collection data, Partitalia in 2024 will continue to innovate by bringing to market technologies designed to automate tracking, with the goal of reducing our environmental impact on the planet. Find out more: smartwaste.partitalia.com
Partitalia Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
When was Partitalia founded?
Partitalia was founded in 2001.
Where is Partitalia's headquarters?
Partitalia's headquarters is located at Via Varese, 26/28, Lainate.
Who are Partitalia's competitors?
Competitors of Partitalia include Unipol Gruppo and 4 more.

Compare Partitalia to Competitors
Wind Tre is a telecommunications company. It offers mobile telephony, fixed telephony, broadband internet, IT services, and many other services. The company was founded in 1999 and is based in Rho, Italy.
APGIS focuses on providing collective insurance services in the insurance industry. The company offers insurance coverage in areas such as health care, death, work stoppages, and disability. It primarily serves sectors such as the pharmaceutical industry, the butcher trade, notary, furniture industry, carton industry, equestrian centers, and pharmacy. It was founded in 1975 and is based in Vincennes, France.
Rete Ferroviaria Italiana (RFI) is an Italian railway company. It provides signaling, maintenance, and other services for the railway network. It was founded in 2001 and is based in Rome, Italy. It is a subsidiary of Ferrovie dello Stato (FS).
SPICA manufactures core and overlay films for cards. The company produces its core for financial cards, identification cards, driving licenses, and passports. It secures payment cards and offers eco-friendly products such as SICO-R (produced entirely from recycled polyvinyl chloride (PVC)). It was formerly known as Liveo Research. The company was founded in 1953 and is based in Varese, Italy.
Elyctis develops, manufactures, and markets readers. It specializes in the development, industrialization, production, and marketing of fixed and mobile readers and software dedicated to securing identity documents. It was founded in 2008 and is based in Pertuis, France.
Softlock is a provider of information security solutions. The company provides IT security, software copy protection, digital rights management, a smart card operating system, a one-time password, and IT training. It was founded in 1997 and is based in Cairo, Egypt.
